title: I.Sicily inscription 000419
support: Large texts incised on the walls of four galleries off the second ditch of the Euryelos fortress

layout.p: Each text is incised on a single line, in the first case on the right as one enters, in the other three cases on the left as one enters

date._: 4th — 3rd century BCE, but whether part of a Dionysian, Agathoclean, or Hieronian phase unclear.

provenanceFound._: First described in situ in the galleries off the second ditch of the fortress by Schubring in the 1860s

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana

museum.name: Area archeologica Castello Eurialo
museum.description: Site of the primary fortifications of the urban defences of Syracuse, later fifth to third centuries BCE
